channel.title: Making it so when you click too fast on a npc, it disconnects you
channel.description:
Point: Making it so when you click too fast on a npc, it disconnects you
What I need: I need som1 to give me codes, and tell me where to search <this> and copy paste under <this>!
This was on my wish list for so long, and now I'm asking you guys for help. I hope you take the time and write a little tut for me :D
Thanks!! PARK!

item.title: Making it so when you click too fast on a npc, it disconnects you
item.dc:creator: @parkview parkview
item.description:
@parkview wrote:

Sorry zenzie

stop pposting like 3-5 times the same thing -.-

I thought the posting wasnt working, but it was actually posting on the second page. I thought i was banned or somthing. My stupid mastake, anyways lets not change subjects and try to get these timers working

Thx for your help people who posted, Ill try it out and get you back if it doesnt work![br][size=1]Posted on: March 02, 2007, 07:53:43 AM[/size][hr]DRACER! THANK YOU VERY VERY VERY MUCH! IT WORKED! REP++ MY FRIEND! YOU JUST MADE MY DAY/WEEK WAY HAPPIER!
[br][size=1]Posted on: March 03, 2007, 12:43:33 PM[/size][hr]Bad news is the fast click works on players, any fix for that? wut would be the public int _____ = 0; ???
[br][size=1]Posted on: March 03, 2007, 02:42:31 PM[/size][hr],

my way of fixing things is very inificient… my best guess is just try messing with the 2 nunbers i mentioned in my first post, the == 10 and the -= 1 the smaller the -= 1 the more time it takes to get it to equal 0, so if that number is set small, it should kick more often. when they get the int to the 10, it kicks them

item.title: Making it so when you click too fast on a npc, it disconnects you
item.dc:creator: @dracar dracar
item.description:
@dracar wrote:

try changing this

if (clicksOnNpc == 10){
disconnected = true;
}

to this

if (clicksOnNpc == 2){
disconnected = true;
}

and i guess if that dont work try chaging this

if (clicksOnNpc >= 1) { clicksOnNpc -= 1; }
to this

if (clicksOnNpc >= 1)
{
clicksOnNpc -= .5;
}

im not sure if integers can have decimals though so idk if that wud work…
hmm how it shud work is, every time u click an npc it adds 1 to the var, if the var = 2 or 10 or watever, it disconects them, and every time the public boolean process executes, it subtracts equal to 1 or .5 or watever, and since public boolean process executes every .5 seconds, it removes the points every .5 second. so if they click faster then it removes points, it kicks them.

Read full topic

item.title: Making it so when you click too fast on a npc, it disconnects you
item.dc:creator: @dracar dracar
item.description:
@dracar wrote:

just like add

public int clicksOnNpc = 0;

outside a void, searhc for public void, then add it right above it.
then search for

public boolean process

and below its { add

if (clicksOnNpc = 10){
disconnected = true;
}
if (clicksOnNpc >= 1)
{
clicksOnNpc -= 1;
}

then search for

case 155: //first Click npc

and add

clicksOnNpc += 1;

then search for

case 17: //second Click npc

and add the same thing,

clicksOnNpc += 1;

then search for

case 72: //Click to attack

and add this again

clicksOnNpc += 1;

that shud work, idk for sure cause i just typed it out from memory…
tell me if i helped at all please ^-^
oh, this is for testscape, idk if it wud be the same for anohter.

Read full topic

item.title: Making it so when you click too fast on a npc, it disconnects you
item.dc:creator: @frugoo_scape frugoo scape
item.description:
@frugoo_scape wrote:

declare: int logclicks;
under the click on the monster method add
logclicks = 2;

under the process boolean method add

if (logclicks > 15){
disconnect = true;
}else{
logclicks = logclicks -1;
}

i am 100% sure this will work. I just came up with this.

Read full topic
